poem:
"The Breath of Pollokshields"

A garden suburb painted in hues of blushed sandstone-
Pollokshields. 
Edwardian shadows whisper on the wide streets, 
Victorian echoes dance beneath the lime trees-
All swaddled in polished green ivy, ripe with time.
Each rail beneath the embankment, a stroke of history's rhyme,
In Glasgow's heart, an understated, suburban climb.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Country diary: This wee park is a suburban underdog | Amanda Thomson I’m in the Southside of Glasgow, walking through Pollokshields, one of the first garden suburbs to be created in Britain. The streets are wide and lined with Edwardian and Victorian villas, and red and blond sandstone tenements, and it’s a part of Glasgow that still feels spacious. The trunks of huge mature lime trees that line the railway embankment are swathed with shiny greens of ivy". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
